p: Some types of plants can produce antibacterial and antifungal substances, even if they present an activity, usually, much lower than that possessed by antibiotics deriving from fungi and bacteria [ 119]. Furthermore, it is good to remember that the antibacterial or antifungal substances contained in these plants can interfere with possible pharmacological treatments already in place. Plants also contain other compounds that could potentially be hazardous to health. However, in the popular medicine of emerging countries, the use of plant preparations to counteract the growth of pathogenic microorganisms is often described.
